intro: Rubus brachyphyllos, commonly known as the short-leaved blackberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
